org.epochx.stats
Class Stats

java.lang.Object
  org.epochx.stats.Stats

public class Stats
extends java.lang.Object

Gathers data and statistics about events that occur during execution of the given Model and makes them available for use. Any component may add data into the Stats by using the addData method. The Stats manager will also make requests of Stat objects to generate the statistic and then stash the results internally. The data that is stored will only be held for until the next occurrence of the ExpiryEvent of the Stat.

To print to a file use the printToStream method, passing in a suitable OutputStream such as FileOutputStream.

Nested Class Summary

          Possible events at which statistics fields can be considered expired.

Method Detail

get

public static Stats get()
Returns the singleton instance of Stats.

Returns:
the only Stats instance.

addData

public void addData(Stat field,
                    java.lang.Object value)
Inserts an item of data about a run into the stats manager associated with the given field key. If data is already stored against the given field then it will be overwritten. The value will be cleared upon the appropriate event as designated by the given stat field's getExpiryEvent method.

Parameters:
field - the key to associate with the given data value.
value - the statistics/data to be stored.

getStat

public java.lang.Object getStat(Stat field)
Retrieves the statistic data associated with the provided field in the stats being stored. If a value for the stat field is not currently held then the getStatValue method on the Stat will be called, with the resulting value returned from this method and also stored for future requests.

The object type of the instance that is returned will be dependent upon the field requested. The object type is normally specified in the documentation for the field.

Parameters:
field - the name of the statistics field to retrieve.
Returns:
an object which represents the statistics data requested or null if the field does not exist or the data is otherwise unavailable.

getStats

public java.lang.Object[] getStats(Stat... fields)
Retrieves a sequence of statistics associated with the given fields. The returned array will be of the same length as the number of fields provided and each element will represent each field in order.

Each statistic field requested will be obtained according to the contract specified by the getStat(Stat) method.

Parameters:
fields - the names of the statistics fields to retrieve.
Returns:
an array of Objects where each element is the statistic field generated for the requested field at that array index. If a field is for data that does not exist or is otherwise unavailable then that array element will be null.

print

public void print(Stat... fields)
Retrieve and print to the standard output the sequence of statistics referenced by the given fields. The statistics will be obtained according to the contract specified by the getStats(Stat[]) method. The result of calling the toString() method on each statistic object returned will be printed separated by a '\t' tab character, and the line terminated with a '\n' newline character.

Parameters:
fields - the Stat fields to print out.

print

public void print(java.lang.String separator,
                  Stat... fields)
Retrieve and print to the standard output the sequence of statistics referenced by the given fields. The statistics will be obtained according to the contract specified by the getStats(Stat[]) method. The result of calling the toString() method on each statistic object returned will be printed separated by the separator String parameter provided, and the line terminated with a '\n' newline character.

Parameters:
fields - the Stat fields to print out.
separator - the String to be printed between each statistic.

printToStream

public void printToStream(java.io.OutputStream out,
                          Stat... fields)
Retrieve and print to an output stream the sequence of statistics referenced by the given fields. The statistics will be obtained according to the contract specified by the getStats(Stat[]) method. The result of calling the toString() method on each statistic object returned will be printed separated by a '\t' tab character, and the line terminated with a '\n' newline character.

Parameters:
out - the OutputStream to print to.
fields - the Stat fields to print to the stream.

printToStream

public void printToStream(java.io.OutputStream out,
                          java.lang.String separator,
                          Stat... fields)
Retrieve and print to an output stream the sequence of statistics referenced by the given fields. The statistics will be obtained according to the contract specified by the getStats(Stat[]) method. The result of calling the toString() method on each statistic object returned will be printed separated by the separator String parameter provided, and the line terminated with a '\n' newline character.

Parameters:
out - the OutputStream to print to.
fields - the Stat fields to print to the stream.
separator - the String to be printed between each statistic.
